sections.title: Section 1: Distance and Similarity in Numeric and Text Data

questions.question: What is the primary goal of comparing documents in a corpus?
When visualizing two customers using complaints (X) and unique products (Y), what does Euclidean distance represent?

options.A: The sum of X and Y
options.C: The straight-line (hypotenuse) distance between two points

sections.title: Section 2: Vector Space Models and Document-Term Matrix

questions.question: What does cosine similarity ignore that Euclidean distance emphasizes?

options.A: It gives a value between -1 and 1, but usually 0 to 1 in text analysis
options.B: A value close to 1 means high similarity
options.D: It is strongly affected by the scale of the data

questions.question: In textual data analysis, what is the typical “space” in which similarity is quantified?

options.C: k-dimensional vector space using a document-term matrix

sections.title: Section 3: Matrix Algebra and Corpus-Wide Comparison

questions.question: Which of the following statements best describes the effect of document length on cosine similarity?
When computing the cosine similarity matrix for all documents, what does the diagonal of the resulting matrix represent?

options.B: Robust to differences in document length
